# isAccessibilityCategory

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the content size category is associated with accessibility.

## Declaration

```swift
var isAccessibilityCategory: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

This property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] for [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIContentSizeCategory/accessibilityMedium], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIContentSizeCategory/accessibilityLarge], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIContentSizeCategory/accessibilityExtraLarge], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIContentSizeCategory/accessibilityExtraExtraLarge], and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIContentSizeCategory/accessibilityExtraExtraExtraLarge]. It is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for other values.

## Accessibility sizes

- **accessibilityMedium**: A medium font size that reflects the current accessibility settings.
- **accessibilityLarge**: A large font size that reflects the current accessibility settings.
- **accessibilityExtraLarge**: An extra-large font size that reflects the current accessibility settings.
- **accessibilityExtraExtraLarge**: A font that is larger than the extra-large font but not the largest available, reflecting the current accessibility settings.
- **accessibilityExtraExtraExtraLarge**: The largest font size that reflects the current accessibility settings.
